alert.note: Alert for Clayton (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued April 14 at 11:03AM CDT until further notice by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Iowa... Wisconsin... Mississippi River at McGregor affecting Grant, Clayton, Allamakee and Crawford Counties. Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10 affecting Grant and Clayton Counties. .Warm temperatures this week have melted much of the regional snowpack. This snowmelt is routing into the Mississippi River. Rain this weekend is expected to further increase river flows. This additional rainfall and upstream inflow has increased the expected crests at McGregor between 18.5 to 20.5 feet around April 22-24 and at Guttenberg between 16.5 to 18.5 feet around April 22-24. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is expected. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Guttenberg Dam 10. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 13.4 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage is expected to be reached early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional river and weather information is available at www.weather.gov/lacrosse. The next statement will be issued this evening by 1100 PM CDT.
